title: 23-minute standing ovation at Hind Rajab film premiere
summary: ‘Free Palestine,’ There was a 23-minute standing ovation at the Venice Film Festival premiere of The Voice of Hind Rajab

title: Google told to pay $425m for breaching millions of users’ privacy
summary: US tech giant says jury decision misunderstands its products and it will appeal.

title: US Open: Sinner dominates Musetti to set up semifinal with Auger-Aliassim
summary: Top-seed Jannik Sinner cruised through the semifinals, losing only seven games to Italian compatriot Lorenzo Musetti.

title: Peru court hands ex-President Toledo new 13-year corruption sentence
summary: Alejandro Toledo is one of five former Peruvian presidents jailed in recent years as political turbulence continues.

title: Experts call on US Health Secretary RFK Jr to resign over misinformation
summary: Health experts said Kennedy's 'repeated efforts to undermine science and public health' left Americans 'less safe'.

title: LIVE: Entire families ‘erased’ as Israel intensifies attacks on Gaza City
summary: The Israeli military has continued its intense assault on northern Gaza City with a series of deadly overnight attacks.

title: Russia says it will not discuss foreign troops in Ukraine in ‘any format’
summary: Foreign Ministry spokeswoman says deployment of a post-conflict security force would be 'fundamentally unacceptable'.

title: Australia to send hundreds to Nauru in $1.6bn migrant resettlement deal
summary: The Pacific island will resettle up to 354 former detainees Canberra says have 'no legal right to remain in Australia'.

title: Naomi Osaka defeats Karolina Muchova to reach US Open semifinal
summary: Osaka returns to semis for the first time since 2020, while Amanda Anisimova gets Wimbledon revenge against Iga Swiatek.

title: At least 60 dead after boat sinks in Nigeria, officials say
summary: Niger State emergency rescue officials said the overloaded vessel sunk after striking a submerged tree stump.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,288
summary: Here are the key events on day 1,288 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: Lisbon’s Gloria funicular derails: What we know about the cause and victims
summary: A Lisbon streetcar, one of the city’s major tourist attractions, derailed on Wednesday, leaving 15 dead and 18 injured.

title: ‘Shameful’: Survivors of Jeffrey Epstein’s abuse push for US transparency
summary: Some survivors spoke publicly for the first time at an event on Capitol Hill to support a bill to release files.

title: Hamas calls for UN action as Israel escalates brutal bombardment of Gaza
summary: Hamas says it is ready to accept a comprehensive Gaza ceasefire, but Israel continues its offensive to seize Gaza City.

title: US judge rules Trump unlawfully cut Harvard University research grants
summary: The decision is a victory for the Ivy League university, which has been locked in a months-long feud with Trump.

title: Israël s'attend à la fuite d'un million d'habitants de Gaza-ville, menacée d'une opération militaire
summary: Alors que la Défense civile de Gaza a fait état mercredi de 62 morts, Israël a affirmé s'attendre à ce qu'un million de Palestiniens fuient Gaza-ville en raison de l'opération militaire prévue par son armée. Dans la soirée à Jérusalem, des manifestants sont redescendus dans la rue à l'appel des familles d'otages.

title: Gaza : l'armée israélienne réintègre ses réservistes en vue d'une offensive sur la ville de Gaza
summary: Israël intensifie mardi 2 septembre ses préparatifs militaires en réintégrant dans ses rangs des milliers de réservistes en vue d'une offensive annoncée sur la ville de Gaza, après près de deux années de guerre contre le Hamas.

title: L'armée israélienne réintègre ses réservistes en vue d'une offensive sur la ville de Gaza
summary: Alors qu'Israël accélère ses préparatifs en vue d'"opérations de combat étendues" pour prendre la ville de Gaza, le président français Emmanuel Macron a mis en garde mardi l'État hébreu contre toute "offensive" ou "tentative d’annexion" de territoires, affirmant que cela n’arrêterait pas le mouvement de reconnaissance de l’État palestinien.

title: L'actu en dessin : une campagne internationale pour le droit d'informer à Gaza
summary: Une mobilisation internationale suivie par de très nombreux médias a eu lieu lundi à l’initiative des ONG Reporters sans frontières (RSF) et Avaaz. L'objectif était à la fois de dénoncer les attaques israéliennes contre les journalistes à Gaza mais aussi de réclamer l'ouverture de l'enclave palestinienne à la presse internationale.

title: Journalistes tués en Syrie en 2012 : Assad et six ex-dignitaires visés par la justice française
summary: Après 13 ans d'enquête, les juges d'instruction du Pôle crimes contre l'humanité du tribunal judiciaire de Paris ont délivré des mandats d'arrêt à l'encontre d'anciens hauts dignitaires du régime syrien, dont l'ex-président Bachar al-Assad, pour complicité de crimes de guerre et de crimes contre l'humanité.

title: Israël accusé de génocide à Gaza par une association de chercheurs
summary: C'est une première depuis le début de la guerre : des spécialistes du génocide accusent formellement Israël d'en commettre un. Une résolution a été adoptée "à une majorité écrasante", explique Mélanie O'Brien, la présidente de l'association de chercheurs en génocide. "La justification de la légitime défense n'est plus d'actualité."

title: La Belgique va, elle aussi, reconnaître l'État de Palestine lors de l'AG de l'ONU en septembre
summary: La Belgique emboîte le pas à la France, au Canada et à l'Australie. Le pays va reconnaître l'État de Palestine à l'Assemblée générale des Nations unies en septembre si "le dernier otage est libéré et que le Hamas n'assume plus quelconque gestion de la Palestine", a annoncé mardi le ministre des Affaires étrangères belge.

title: Villes gérées par IA, îles artificielles et profits colossaux... Le plan de Trump pour Gaza
summary: Un document confidentiel révélé dimanche par le Washington Post détaille le projet de Donald Trump pour la bande de Gaza : placer l’enclave palestinienne sous administration américaine pendant dix ans, déplacer sa population et transformer le territoire dévasté en centre touristique et technologique. Un plan aux allures de nettoyage ethnique fantasmé par le président américain depuis février.

title: Après un faux départ, la flottille pour Gaza reprend la mer
summary: Partie de Barcelone dimanche, la flottille pour Gaza avait dû rebrousser chemin face à des vents violents en Méditerranée. Elle a finalement repris la mer lundi soir. Les militants embarqués, dont la Suédoise Greta Thunberg, veulent briser le blocus israélien et acheminer de l'aide humanitaire aux Palestiniens de l'enclave.

title: Mobilisation mondiale des médias pour dénoncer les assassinats de journalistes gazaouis par Israël
summary: Plus de quarante rédactions françaises, dont France 24 et RFI, participent à une campagne internationale lancée par Reporters sans frontières pour dénoncer les attaques israéliennes contre les journalistes à Gaza. L’initiative rassemble plus de 250 médias dans 72 pays.

title: Israël confirme avoir tué Abou Obeida, le porte-parole de la branche armée du Hamas
summary: Israël a annoncé dimanche avoir tué le porte-parole de la branche armée du mouvement islamiste Hamas dans la bande de Gaza, à l'heure où son armée poursuit son offensive dans le territoire palestinien affamé et ravagé par la guerre. "Le porte-parole terroriste du Hamas, Abou Obeida, a été éliminé à Gaza et a rejoint les autres (personnes) éliminées de l'axe du mal d'Iran, du Liban et du Yémen au fond de l'enfer", a affirmé le ministre de la Défense israélien, Israël Katz, sur son compte X.

title: 150 médias noircissent leur Unes pour protester contre la mort des journalistes à Gaza
summary: À la Une de la presse ce lundi 1er septembre, cette opération de Reporters sans frontières (RSF) dans 150 médias internationaux pour protester contre la mort des journalistes à Gaza, le plan d'évacuation et de reconstruction de l'administration Trump pour l'après-guerre dans l'enclave et le fossé qui se creuse de plus en plus entre l'école publique et l'école privée en France, en ce jour de rentrée des classes.

title: Israël annonce avoir tué le porte-parole de la branche armée du Hamas
summary: Israël a annoncé dimanche avoir tué le porte-parole de la branche armée du mouvement islamiste Hamas dans la bande de Gaza, à l'heure où son armée poursuit son offensive dans le territoire palestinien affamé et ravagé par la guerre.

title: Yémen : l'ONU condamne la "détention arbitraire" d'au moins onze de ses employés par les Houthis
summary: L'Organisation des Nations unies a condamné dimanche la détention d'au moins onze membres de son personnel par les Houthis au Yémen. Cette vague d'arrestations, menée à Sanaa et Hodeïda, intervient au lendemain de la confirmation de la mort du chef du gouvernement houthi dans des frappes israéliennes.

title: Liban : l'armée israélienne affirme avoir frappé des sites du Hezbollah dans le sud du pays
summary: Israël a annoncé avoir mené, dimanche, des frappes contre des sites du Hezbollah, près du château de Beaufort, dans le sud du Liban. Selon l'armée, ces frappes faisaient suite à la détection d'une "activité militaire". Elles ont provoqué de fortes explosions et d'importants dégâts matériels, rapporte l'ANI.

title: En direct, Gaza : seul un quart des détenus de Gaza sont identifiés comme combattants par les services de renseignements militaires israéliens, selon une enquête du « Guardian »
summary: Une enquête publiée jeudi, menée par le journal britannique, le média israélo-palestinien + 972 Magazine et le journal en hébreu Local Call, révèle l’ampleur des détentions civiles parmi les Palestiniens emprisonnés par Israël. Y figurent des travailleurs médicaux, enseignants, fonctionnaires, professionnels des médias, écrivains, personnes malades et handicapées et enfants.

title: A Lisbonne, le déraillement du funiculaire de Gloria plonge la ville dans le deuil
summary: Dans l’attente des résultats de l’enquête, le maire de la capitale portugaise a ordonné la suspension immédiate des autres funiculaires de la ville afin d’y mener des inspections techniques. Le Quai d’Orsay a annoncé qu’une Française faisait partie des blessés.

title: Donald Trump saisit la Cour suprême pour sauver les droits de douane qu’il a mis en place, jugés illégaux
summary: Face à la menace d’une suspension de ses droits de douane, Donald Trump mise sur la Cour suprême pour préserver un outil-clé de négociation dans sa stratégie commerciale internationale.

title: En direct, guerre en Ukraine : Moscou rejette toute intervention étrangère sur le sol ukrainien en cas de paix
summary: La Russie a de nouveau dénoncé les garanties de sécurités souhaitées par Kiev, alors qu’une réunion de la « coalition des volontaires » est prévue sur le sujet jeudi à Paris.

title: Google condamné aux Etats-Unis à payer 425,7 millions de dollars pour atteinte à la vie privée
summary: Une cour fédérale de San Francisco a condamné le géant du Web à dédommager près de 100 millions d’utilisateurs pour avoir collecté leurs données personnelles alors même qu’ils avaient désactivé le paramètre de suivi.

title: Guerre en Ukraine : les Européens sont devenus les principaux bailleurs de fonds de l’armée de Kiev
summary: Selon l’Institut allemand Kiel, depuis juin, l’Europe a fourni environ 95 milliards de dollars d’aide militaire à Kiev, contre 75 milliards pour Washington. Les armes restent en grande partie fabriquées outre-Atlantique.

title: « La France de 2025 n’est pas le Portugal de 2011, passé sous les fourches Caudines du FMI »
summary: Quoi qu’en disent les Cassandre, la France n’est pas près d’être mise sous tutelle : l’équilibre de ses paiements courants et la forte épargne de ses ménages la protègent de ce risque, explique Pascal Riché, journaliste au « Monde », dans sa chronique.

title: Pérou : l’ancien président Alejandro Toledo condamné à treize ans de prison pour blanchiment d’argent lié au scandale de l’Odebrecht
summary: Déjà condamné à vingt ans de prison pour corruption en octobre 2024, l’ex-chef d’Etat ne verra pas les deux peines se cumuler, le système judiciaire péruvien privilégiant la plus sévère.

title: « Le partenariat, même inégal, qu’était l’Alliance atlantique devient une affaire où les Etats-Unis marchandent leur protection »
summary: Les Européens, soucieux d’éviter que les Etats-Unis se désengagent de l’Ukraine, balancent entre soumission raisonnée et émancipation. Mais, pour le président américain, indifférent à l’argument politico-moral, l’OTAN doit avant tout « rapporter », analyse, dans sa chronique, Alain Frachon, éditorialiste au « Monde ».

title: Harvard remporte une victoire judiciaire importante face à Donald Trump
summary: L’administration Trump a privé la prestigieuse université américaine de 2,6 milliards de dollars de subventions, sous prétexte de lutte contre l’antisémitisme. Une action illégale, a statué une juge fédérale.

title: En Argentine, une condamnation exemplaire pour chasse illégale de jaguar
summary: Quatre hommes ont écopé de deux ans de prison après avoir été reconnus coupables d’avoir tué un individu de cette espèce protégée, considérée comme un « monument naturel national ».

title: Maroc : la militante féministe Ibtissame Lachgar condamnée à trente mois de prison pour « atteinte à l’islam »
summary: Un tribunal de Rabat a condamné une des figures du féminisme marocain, Ibtissame Lachgar, pour avoir publié une photo d’elle vêtue d’un t-shirt où le mot « Allah » était suivi de « is lesbian ».

title: Affaire Epstein : des victimes du prédateur sexuel menacent de publier leur propre liste de personnes impliquées
summary: Lors d’une conférence de presse devant le Capitole, dix femmes ont de nouveau exhorté l’administration Trump à rendre public l’ensemble de ce dossier qui alimente de multiples théories complotistes.

title: La Floride en passe de supprimer l’obligation vaccinale, y compris pour les enfants
summary: Cette initiative se situe en droite ligne avec la profonde refonte de la politique vaccinale portée par l’administration Trump. Une décision décriée par des experts et des élus d’Etats démocrates.

title: En Allemagne, le drapeau et l’hymne national en débat
summary: Trente-cinq ans après la réunification, un des vice-présidents du Bundestag propose de changer ces deux symboles, contestés dans l’ex-RDA. Des élus d’extrême droite souhaitent, eux, réintégrer à l’hymne une strophe qui n’est plus chantée depuis la chute du IIIᵉ Reich.

title: Israeli forces arrest 16 Palestinians amid West Bank crackdown
summary:
Israeli forces arrest 16 Palestinians amid West Bank crackdown

Israeli forces arrested at least 16 Palestinians across the occupied West Bank last night, including a woman, Al Jazeera sources reported.

The arrests come alongside Israel’s ongoing genocide in Gaza.

According to Palestinian authorities, Israeli forces and settlers in the West Bank, including East Jerusalem, have killed at least 1,017 Palestinians, wounded nearly 7,000, and detained more than 18,500 since 7 October 2023.

title: Venice audience left in tears during film about Gaza genocide victim Hind Rajab
summary:
Venice audience left in tears during film about Gaza genocide victim Hind Rajab

A film about a five-year-old Palestinian girl killed by Israeli soldiers received a 23 minute standing ovation at the Venice Film Festival on Wednesday.

Directed by Tunisian filmmaker  Kaouther Ben Hania, The Voice of Hind Rajab,  left much of the audience and cast in tears after the screening.

Members of the audience also broke out into chants of "free Palestine" after the screening had concluded.

The docudrama, which was showing during the 82nd iteration of the festival,  tells the story of a Palestinian girl who fled Gaza City with six of her family members in January 2024 when their vehicle was shelled by Israeli tanks.

Her uncle, aunt, and three cousins all died in the attack.

Read more: Venice audience left in tears during film about Gaza genocide victim Hind Rajab

title: Venice audience left in tears during film about Gaza genocide victim Hind Rajab
summary:
Venice audience left in tears during film about Gaza genocide victim Hind Rajab

Submitted by MEE staff on Thu, 09/04/2025 - 08:22
The six-year-old girl was killed by Israeli soldiers in January 2024 while she was fleeing Gaza City in a car
Israeli actor Amer Hlehel (left), Tunisian director Kaouther Ben Hania, actress Saja Kilani, actor Motaz Malhees, actress Clara Khoury pose with a portrait of Hind Rajab at the 82nd International Venice Film Festival on 3 September (AFP/Tiziana Fabi)
Off

A film about a six-year-old Palestinian girl killed by Israeli soldiers in Gaza received a 23 minute standing ovation at the Venice Film Festival on Wednesday.

Directed by Tunisian filmmaker Kaouther Ben Hania, The Voice of Hind Rajab left much of the audience and cast in tears after the screening.

Members of the audience also broke out into chants of "free Palestine" after the screening had concluded.

The docudrama, which was showing during the 82nd iteration of the festival, tells the story of a Palestinian girl who fled Gaza City with six of her family members in January 2024 when their vehicle was shelled by Israeli tanks.

Her uncle, aunt and three cousins all died in the attack.

Rajab and another cousin - who initially survived - contacted the Palestine Red Crescent Society (PRCS) by phone seeking help and a recording of that conversation was later made public.

The child was heard pleading, "please come, I am scared".

Before medics could reach the children, Israeli soldiers resumed fire on the vehicle, killing them.

Hind Rajab, Palestinian child killed by Israel, honoured one year after her death
Read More »

An investigation by Forensic Architecture found that Israeli soldiers knew that there were children in the vehicle and that at least 335 bullets were fired at it.

Last week, Hollywood stars Joaquin Phoenix and Brad Pitt joined a group of film industry figures putting their weight behind the movie.

Pitt and Phoenix were joined as executive directors by Oscar-winning filmmaker Jonathan Glazer, Roma director Alfonso Cuaron and actress Rooney Mara.

Speaking about her film, Ben Hania said: "I cannot accept a world where a child calls for help and no one comes. That pain, that failure, belongs to all of us."

Rajab's image has become symbolic of Israel's genocide of Palestinians in Gaza and the disproportionate toll it has taken on children.

More than 63,000 people have been killed by Israel in the Gaza Strip, according to the enclave's health ministry.

At least 18,000 of those killed were children.

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: Israeli attacks kill 28 Palestinians in Gaza, including aid seekers
summary:
Israeli attacks kill 28 Palestinians in Gaza, including aid seekers

Israeli forces have killed at least 28 Palestinians across Gaza since dawn, hospital told Al Jazeera Arabic, as the death toll continues to climb under relentless bombardment.

At least 16 people were killed in Gaza City alone, while four others were shot dead as they searched for aid in central and southern parts of the besieged enclave.

The attacks come amid Israel’s ongoing genocide in Gaza, which has already left tens of thousands dead, with neighbourhoods flattened and civilians facing famine.

title: Around 75 percent of Palestinians seized from Gaza by Israel are civilians: Report
summary:
Around 75 percent of Palestinians seized from Gaza by Israel are civilians: Report

Classified Israeli military data shows that only one in four Palestinians detained from Gaza are identified as fighters, exposing the massive scale of civilian imprisonment under Israel’s ongoing war in Gaza.

The findings, uncovered by The Guardian, +972 Magazine, and Local Call, reveal that by May, Israel had detained more than 6,000 Palestinians under its “unlawful combatants” law, which permits indefinite detention without charge or trial.

Most of those locked up without charge or trial are civilians, including doctors, teachers, writers, civil servants, children, and people with chronic illnesses or disabilities.

Among the most shocking cases is an 82-year-old woman with Alzheimer’s who was jailed for six weeks. In another, a single mother was separated from her children for 53 days, only to find them begging on the streets when she was finally released.

A soldier who served at the notorious Sde Teiman military base, in which torture and rape have of Palestinian prisoners has occurred, said it once held so many elderly, disabled, and sick detainees that they were crammed into a hangar dubbed “the geriatric pen.”

The United Nations has called Israel's treatment of Palestinians held in these camps "unacceptable".

title: Israeli attacks kill 20 Palestinians in Gaza since dawn as death toll nears 64,000
summary:
Israeli attacks kill 20 Palestinians in Gaza since dawn as death toll nears 64,000

Israeli forces have killed at least 20 Palestinians across Gaza since dawn, according to medical sources speaking to Al Jazeera Arabic.

Backed by unwavering US support, Israel’s genocide in Gaza has continued since its assault began on 7 October 2023.

Local authorities say at least 63,746 Palestinians have been killed and 161,245 wounded, the majority women and children. More than 10,000 remain missing, hundreds of thousands have been displaced, and a famine has already claimed 367 lives.

title: Turkey bans Enrico Macias concert over singer’s support for Israeli genocide
summary:
Turkey bans Enrico Macias concert over singer’s support for Israeli genocide

Turkish officials have cancelled a concert by French singer Enrico Macias in Istanbul, citing public anger over his support for Israel’s assault on Gaza.

The Istanbul governorate announced the decision on Wednesday, saying it sought to prevent protests against “the genocide of the terrorist state Israel in Gaza and its supporters” during Friday’s event.

Macias, 86, expressed dismay over the cancellation, telling AFP he was “deeply surprised and saddened not to be able to see my audience, with whom I have always shared values of peace and fraternity.” The artist, born in Algeria to a Jewish family, has repeatedly defended Israel’s war on Gaza, saying in an August YouTube interview that “if there was violence on the Israeli side, it was because of Hamas.”

Enrico Macias has also participated in concerts to raise millions of dollars for the Israeli army.

title: Colombia slashes coal sales to Israel
summary:
Colombia slashes coal sales to Israel

Colombia’s coal exports fell sharply in July, with sales dropping nearly half compared to last year, according to government data released on Wednesday.

The figures come days after President Gustavo Petro reaffirmed a ban on coal exports to Israel over its genocide in Gaza.

The country sold $479.8m worth of coal in July, a 45.8 percent drop from $885.8m in the same month of 2024, the National Administrative Department of Statistics said. Colombia, Latin America’s largest coal producer, has seen the sector shrink for five straight quarters as international prices collapse.

Mining unions say increased production in Indonesia has driven global prices down. But Petro’s stance has shifted focus from market losses to Colombia’s moral leadership, with the president doubling down on his decision to stop supplying Israel, once Colombia’s biggest coal buyer.

title: Israeli defence minister threatens ‘death of firstborns’ in Yemen
summary:
Israeli defence minister threatens ‘death of firstborns’ in Yemen

Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz has threatened to escalate attacks against Yemen’s Houthis after the group fired three missiles towards Israel this week in retaliation at Israeli strikes.

Katz posted on X, referencing biblical plagues, and warned that Israel would bring “the plague of darkness” and “the plague of the death of the firstborns” upon the Houthis. He added that Israel would “complete all ten plagues” against the group.

The warning comes after missiles were launched from Yemen on Wednesday and Thursday, which is the latest in a string of Houthi operations against Israel and in the Red Sea. 

The group sank two tankers in July and has pledged to continue targeting Israel-linked shipping as part of its declared support for Palestinians and opposition to Israel’s genocide in Gaza.

title: Morning recap
summary:
Morning recap

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Israeli attacks have killed at least 73 Palestinians across Gaza. Officials report that 43 of these deaths occurred in Gaza City alone as Israel's genocide enters its 698th day.

In other developments:

  • A security source informs the Israeli daily Haaretz that between 70,000 and 80,000 people have fled Gaza City in recent days, with most displacements occurring within the past 72 hours.

  • Hamas announces it has agreed to the formation of an independent administration to govern Gaza. The group states it is ready for a comprehensive truce that would see the release of all Israeli captives.

  • The office of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu rejected the proposal, reiterating that the war will only end upon the release of all captives and the disarmament of Hamas.

  • The Israeli military says it detected a missile launch from Yemen early on Thursday, the third such incident in 24 hours, and is working to intercept it.

  • Tens of thousands of protesters gathered outside Netanyahu's Jerusalem residence in a major demonstration demanding a deal to free the captives, with further protests planned.

title: Live: Three-quarters of Palestinians taken from Gaza to Israeli prisons are civilians
summary:
Live: Three-quarters of Palestinians taken from Gaza to Israeli prisons are civilians

Submitted by MEE staff on Thu, 09/04/2025 - 06:10
Hamas stated it has agreed to an independent administration for Gaza and is ready for a comprehensive truce
Key Points
Almost 21,000 children left disabled due to Israel's war on Gaza
UAE says Israeli annexation of occupied West Bank a 'red line'
Spain slams EU over double standards on Gaza and Ukraine

The findings, uncovered by The Guardian, +972 Magazine, and Local Call, reveal that by May, Israel had detained more than 6,000 Palestinians under its “unlawful combatants” law, which permits indefinite detention without charge or trial.

Most of those locked up without charge or trial are civilians, including doctors, teachers, writers, civil servants, children, and people with chronic illnesses or disabilities.

Among the most shocking cases is an 82-year-old woman with Alzheimer’s who was jailed for six weeks. In another, a single mother was separated from her children for 53 days, only to find them begging on the streets when she was finally released.

A soldier who served at the notorious Sde Teiman military base, in which torture and rape have of Palestinian prisoners has occurred, said it once held so many elderly, disabled, and sick detainees that they were crammed into a hangar dubbed “the geriatric pen.”

The United Nations has called Israel's treatment of Palestinians held in these camps "unacceptable".

Israeli attacks kill 28 Palestinians in Gaza, including aid seekers

Israeli forces have killed at least 28 Palestinians across Gaza since dawn, hospital told Al Jazeera Arabic, as the death toll continues to climb under relentless bombardment.

At least 16 people were killed in Gaza City alone, while four others were shot dead as they searched for aid in central and southern parts of the besieged enclave.

The attacks come amid Israel’s ongoing genocide in Gaza, which has already left tens of thousands dead, with neighbourhoods flattened and civilians facing famine.

Venice audience left in tears during film about Gaza genocide victim Hind Rajab

A film about a five-year-old Palestinian girl killed by Israeli soldiers received a 23 minute standing ovation at the Venice Film Festival on Wednesday.

Directed by Tunisian filmmaker  Kaouther Ben Hania, The Voice of Hind Rajab,  left much of the audience and cast in tears after the screening.

Members of the audience also broke out into chants of "free Palestine" after the screening had concluded.

The docudrama, which was showing during the 82nd iteration of the festival,  tells the story of a Palestinian girl who fled Gaza City with six of her family members in January 2024 when their vehicle was shelled by Israeli tanks.

Her uncle, aunt, and three cousins all died in the attack.

Read more: Venice audience left in tears during film about Gaza genocide victim Hind Rajab

Israeli forces arrest 16 Palestinians amid West Bank crackdown

Israeli forces arrested at least 16 Palestinians across the occupied West Bank last night, including a woman, Al Jazeera sources reported.

The arrests come alongside Israel’s ongoing genocide in Gaza.

According to Palestinian authorities, Israeli forces and settlers in the West Bank, including East Jerusalem, have killed at least 1,017 Palestinians, wounded nearly 7,000, and detained more than 18,500 since 7 October 2023.

‘Stop starving Gaza’: Cosmetics giant Lush closes UK stores in solidarity with Palestinians
Gaza famine deaths surge as Israel escalates air strikes
‘No heartbeat’: Gaza’s pregnant and elderly bear brunt of Israel’s starvation

title: Netanyahu accuses Israeli protestors calling for hostage deal of being "fascist militias"
summary:
Netanyahu accuses Israeli protestors calling for hostage deal of being "fascist militias"

Tens of thousands of Israelis demonstrated outside prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu's Jerusalem home calling for a hostage deal, Haaretz repoted on Wednesday.

Netanyahu accused the protestors of threatening to murder him and his family, and acting like "fascist militias," leading to an outcry by the families of hostages.

He also criticized the police for not doing enough to contain protesters.

title: Israel rejects Hamas's ceasefire statement
summary:
Israel rejects Hamas's ceasefire statement

Israel rejected Hamas's statement on Wednesday announcing its readiness to reach a ceasefire deal, describing it as "more spin from Hamas that contains nothing new".

Hamas has been waiting for Israel's response to a comprehensive cease-fire deal it agreed to several weeks ago – including the establishment of a technocratic government that would control Gaza.

Despite this, the Israeli security cabinet did not discuss the hostage deal over the last few weeks, despite meeting several times and protests across the country.

Instead, meetings have focused primarily preparations for a military takeover of Gaza City, Haaretz reported

title: Film about Hind Rajab leaves audience in tears at Venice Film Festival
summary:
Film about Hind Rajab leaves audience in tears at Venice Film Festival

A film about a five-year-old Palestinian girl who was killed by the Israeli military received a 23 minute standing ovation at the Venice Film Festival on Tuesday.

The Voice of Hind Rajab left much of the audience and cast in tears after the screening.

It tells the story of Rajab who fled Gaza City with six of her family members in January 2024 when their vehicle was shelled by tanks. Her uncle, aunt, and three cousins all died in the attack.

Rajab and another cousin - who initially survived - contacted the Palestine Red Crescent Society (PRCS) by phone seeking help.

However, Israeli tanks also killed Rajab and the paramedics who came to help her.

Rajab's car was found to have more than 300 rounds fired into it.

Students at Columbia University renamed Hamilton Hall, calling it Hind’s Hall.

title: 'Formalising apartheid': Smotrich West Bank annexation plans widely condemned
summary:
'Formalising apartheid': Smotrich West Bank annexation plans widely condemned

Submitted by Maysa Mustafa on Wed, 09/03/2025 - 18:48
Critics online say Israel's 'mask is finally off' as the finance minister proposes ending any prospect of a Palestinian state
Israeli far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich displays a map of an area near the settlement of Maale Adumim, a land corridor known as E1, outside Jerusalem in the occupied West Bank, on 14 August 2025 (Menahem Kahana / AFP)
Off

Israel's Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich has triggered a wave of reactions after he unveiled a controversial plan to annex the vast majority of occupied Palestinian territory.

Speaking at a press conference on Wednesday, Smotrich proposed absorbing 82 percent of the occupied West Bank into Israel, a move that would effectively eliminate the prospect of a future Palestinian state.

Under the proposal, only six isolated enclave.s - where major Palestinian cities such as Jenin, Tulkarm, Nablus, Ramallah, Jericho and Hebron are located - would remain outside of Israeli control. All other areas, including dozens of towns and villages, would be formally annexed.

According to the plan, the Palestinian Authority (PA) - which was established under the 1993 Oslo Accords between Israel and the Palestine Liberation Organisation and serves as the internationally recognised governing body in parts of the West Bank - would be gradually dismantled. 

In its place, Smotrich suggested the establishment of "regional civilian management alternatives".

If the PA were to resist, it would be "destroyed", he warned.

"Judea and Samaria are not disputed territory; they are the inheritance of our ancestors for generations," Smotrich said. "There will never, and can never be, a Palestinian state in our land."

The minister presented a map illustrating the proposal, which bore the official logo of the Ministry of Defence. Reactions to the map have been circulating online, with many saying that Israel is "no longer hiding" its plans of completely absorbing the occupied West Bank. 

There are about 7.5 million Palestinians (2 million with Israeli citizenship and 2nd class status) and 7.2 million Jews between the river and the sea

Israel's military-messianic regime is formalizing apartheid

The mask is officially off https://t.co/m87ZUYcMdX

— Max Blumenthal (@MaxBlumenthal) September 3, 2025

Yehud Shaul, co-founder of the Israeli anti-occupation organisation Breaking the Silence, was among many social media users who say the map is proof of apartheid.

"Reminds me of another map in a different continent, from the 20th century. There is a word in Afrikaans to describe that regime," he wrote. 

An anti-occupation activist in Israel echoed this sentiment on X, writing: "After decades of lies and deception, the masks are finally off, and the situation on the ground has now become official, formally endorsed by the Ministry of 'Defense': The State of Israel is an apartheid state, from the river to the sea."

Is there a word for indefinitely ruling over a people who, because they lack your faith and ethnicity, have no voting rights? https://t.co/kOPnLC6uaR

— Zaid Jilani (@ZaidJilani) September 3, 2025

One social media user argued that the plans have been enacted long before the press conference, and that Israel "already treats the entire territory as if it were its sovereign territory".

"The West Bank is already de facto annexed. Israel is already pursuing a strategy of 'maximum land and minimum population'. This is just official recognition of the apartheid reality on the ground."

A post on X pointed out that during the press conference, Smotrich featured a photo of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu voting on Israel being sovereign over the West Bank – signalling that this position isn't marginal, but one from the top of Israel's leadership.

Smotrich was clever to show Netanyahu voting in the Knesset for Israel to declare sovereignty over the West Bank. The western politicians who try to blame Smotrich or Ben Gvir need to be shown it comes from Netanyahu. pic.twitter.com/iHlKYGkQI6

— Philip (@rulesbasedworld) September 3, 2025

The United Arab Emirates responded to Smotrich's plan on Wednesday, firmly warning Israel that annexation of the occupied West Bank would constitute a "red line".

"From the very beginning, we viewed the [Abraham] Accords as a way to enable our continued support for the Palestinian people and their legitimate aspiration for an independent state,” Lana Nusseibeh, the foreign ministry's assistant minister for political affairs, said in a statement. 

"We call on the Israeli government to suspend these plans. Extremists of any kind cannot be allowed to dictate the region's trajectory. Peace requires courage, persistence and a refusal to let violence define our choices."

Former US Ambassador to Israel Dan Shapiro weighed in on X, warning President Donald Trump that the Abraham Accords risk collapse if Israel is left to chart its own course on annexation - something current Ambassador Mike Huckabee has signalled the US would permit.

"The message from the UAE to Israel could not be stronger or more clear: annexation of the West Bank is playing with fire. Trump wants regional integration, more Abraham Accords, Saudi normalization? He should not 'leave the decision to Israel' when it's Smotrich's hands on the wheel and US interests are at stake," Shapiro wrote. 

Palestinian-American political analyst Omar Baddar also commented on the UAE warning to Israel, observing that the "red line" wasn't Israel's ongoing genocide in Gaza. 

"This is a red line, but for some reason, genocide wasn't," he posted on X.
